entry.title: my environment
entry.content:
Books to read
  • Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides - Design Patterns
  • Joshua Bloch - Effective Java Programming Language
  • Kent Beck - Test Driven Development By Example
  • Martin Fowler - Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture
  • Martin Fowler - Refactoring Improving the Design of Existing Code
  • The Design Patterns Java Companion
Articles to read
  • Joel on Software
  • martin fowler
Reference books
  • BetterBuildsWithMaven.pdf
  • hibernate_reference-3.1.pdf
  • spring-reference
Technologies
  • agile methodology
API:
  • j2ee: springframework
  • unit: junit, dbunit
  • mockup: jmock
  • time: jodatime
Tools
  • build: maven
  • scripts: ant
  • installer: ant-ui
  • scm: subversion
  • scm-win-client: tortoise svn
  • dev: eclipse
  • editor-win: notepad++
  • db-tool: aquadatastudio
  • file-manager-win: totalcmd
  • file-manager-linux: mc
  • os: kubuntu, windows xp
  • test: jmeter
  • uml design: staruml, posseidon
  • ui-java-editor: JFormDesigner
News
  • theServerSide

Tools
  • build: maven
  • scripts: ant
  • installer: ant-ui

  • os: kubuntu, windows xp
  • test: jmeter
  • uml design: staruml, posseidon
  • ui-java-editor: JFormDesigner

Technologies & api:
  • j2ee: spring
  • unit: junit, dbunit
  • mockup: jmock

Books to read
  • Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides - Design Patterns
  • Joshua Bloch - Effective Java Programming Language
  • Kent Beck - Test Driven Development By Example
  • Martin Fowler - Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture

entry.title: Software is about tools
entry.content:
Software has layers. Each layer contains one or more paradigms reflected throught languages.
Layer 1 - code
Layer 2 - assambler
paradigm: hardware oriented software.
constraints: small time, small memory
Layer 3 - general languages (describe the solution)
procedural paradigm
object paradigm
functional paradigm
Layer 4 - (describe the problem/request)
